content.text: table is a base table in a Microsoft SQL Server database, designed to store information about meters, in a utility or service context. Each record in this table represents a unique meter, identified by a sequence ID. The table captures both original and current meter numbers, associates each meter with an account, and links to a header record through a foreign key. It also tracks metadata such as the user who authenticated the entry, timestamps for when the record was added and last updated, and system time boundaries for temporal data management.
The complexity of this table is considered medium due to the following factors:
It includes a primary key and a foreign key relationship.
It utilizes default constraints and user-defined functions for timestamp management.
It incorporates temporal data management with

This table is used in a utility or service management system to track meters associated with customer accounts. Use cases include:
Tracking changes in meter numbers over time.
Associating meters with customer accounts for billing and service management.
Auditing changes and updates to meter records through user authentication and timestamps.
Supporting temporal queries to understand the state of meters at any given point in time.
